sentences.sContent: The moment we saw the house, we knew we wanted to buy it.
sentences.sCn: 我们一看到这房子就知道我们要买。

sentences.sContent: He crouched down so he couldn’t be seen.
sentences.sCn: 他蹲下来好让别人看不见他。

sentences.sContent: Can I see your ticket, please?
I saw the offer advertised in the newspaper.
sentences.sCn: 我在报纸上看到这个减价的广告。

sentences.sContent: Have you seen Chris (= do you know where he is ) ?
The accommodation was so awful it had to be seen to be believed (= you would not believe it if you did not see it yourself ) .
sentences.sCn: 住宿条件太糟了，不是亲眼所见是不会相信的。

phrases.pCn: 看中(或喜欢)某人的某个方面
经常和…在一起；经常见到
[美国口语]听我说；喂(唤起对方注意或表示不赞成)
正如你所看到的；你是知道的
再见；待会儿见；希望尽快见到你

trans.tranCn: 看见， 看到； 领会
trans.tranOther: to notice or examine someone or something, using your eyes
